title: Visting the Bay Area
text:
In our 6 years of life here, we have come to love the East Bay and the greater Bay Area. We‚Äôll be overjoyed to have so many of our loved ones visiting for our wedding weekend. Whether you‚Äôre just looking for lodging recommendations, or planning to stay and explore beautiful California, you‚Äôll find some of our favorite recommendations below.
This is just a start, but we could talk about Berkeley, Oakland, San Francisco, Marin, Yosemite, Tahoe, etc. etc. etc. at great length! Feel free to reach out if you want any specific recommendations; we‚Äôll be so glad to help!

title: Visting the Bay Area
text:
Suggested Neighborhoods






The Gilman / Westbrae Neightborhood





This may not be a fair suggestion, as hotels are harder to come by, but this is our beloved neighborhood. We‚Äôll plan to host in our cozy home for parts of the weekend, so if you can find an AirBnb in our walkable neighborhood, you‚Äôll be close to the fun :)
Solano Ave. and North Berkeley BART are convenient from here.









Downtown Berkeley





Downtown Berkeley is the city‚Äôs central location for restaurants and attractions. It‚Äôs near the beautiful UC Berkeley Campus and has access to the Downtown Berkeley BART Station. This neighborhood is also quite close to our ceremony venue, the UC Berkeley Botanical Garden!
You‚Äôll find hotels to pick from around here, and some restaurants dear to us (Jupiter?!?)









Emeryville





Emeryville is proximate to Berkeley and Oakland and is famously home to Pixar Studio‚Äôs and America‚Äôs Bike Mayor. It‚Äôs a bike- and predestrian-friendly city with access to Berkeley and Oakland. There are a few hotels with views of the Bay here!
